verbs.description: disassemble (third-person singular simple present disassembles, present participle disassembling, simple past and past participle disassembled)

entries.meaning: To take to pieces; to reverse the process of assembly.
examples: To perform the repair it was necessary to disassemble most of the mechanism.

entries.meaning: (computing) To convert machine code to a human-readable, mnemonic form.
